caption: A photo of a large indoor icicle was taken during the Texas blackout in February 2021.

result.explanation: The entity "Texas" is correctly identified and used in the caption.  It accurately reflects the location mentioned in the news caption. The repeated mention of Texas is also reflected in the entities.

candidates.title: Is This Massive, Ceiling-to-Floor Icicle From the Texas Storms?
candidates.content:
Claim:
A photo of a large indoor icicle was taken during the Texas blackout in February 2021.
Rating:
False
About this rating
In late February 2021, Texas experienced an unprecedented winter storm that disrupted the state's electrical grid, leaving millions without power during frigid cold weather. Several disturbing images from the blackout went viral on social media. One image shared on several different Twitter accounts, however, had nothing to do with that power outage, despite claims to the contrary:
The author of the above tweet asserted this image to be taken in Texas during the 2021 blackouts, but this is impossible. The image used in that tweet has been on the internet for years.
For example, the image appears in a January 2018 article on EbaumsWorld titled "36 Amusing Pictures That Will Destroy Your Boredom." It can be found, as well, in a December 2019 article about preventing frozen pipes on the website of the company Thompson Building Associates.
Because the photo predates the Texas blackout by several years, online claims linking it to current events in Texas are "False."
candidates.description: A photo of an impressive looking indoor icicle was shared frequently online during the Texas blackouts.

result.explanation: The claim that a photo of a large indoor icicle was taken during the Texas blackout in February 2021 is rated as FALSE by Snopes.  Snopes provides evidence showing the image has been circulating online for years, predating the Texas blackout.  This evidence demonstrates the caption is inaccurate.
result.supporting_points: Source 1 (Snopes): The image used in the tweet asserting the icicle photo was taken during the 2021 Texas blackouts has been on the internet for years, appearing in articles from 2018 and 2019.  Because the photo predates the Texas blackout by several years, online claims linking it to current events in Texas are "False."

final_result.explanation: The internal check correctly identifies the location mentioned in the caption. However, the external check from Snopes strongly refutes the claim that the image was taken during the Texas blackout in February 2021. Snopes provides evidence showing the image circulated online years before the event, demonstrating the caption is inaccurate and out of context.  The high confidence score reflects the strong evidence provided by Snopes, a reputable fact-checking source.
final_result.validation_summary: Internal check confirms the presence of the location "Texas" in the caption and image. External check from Snopes reveals the image predates the Texas blackout, contradicting the caption's claim. The caption is deemed out of context due to the strong external evidence.
